clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Exoskeleton ATLAS 2030 as Robot-assisted Physical Therapy to Children With Neuromuscular Diseases
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Safety of ATLAS 2030 in the Application of Robot-assisted Physical Therapy to Children With Neuromuscular Diseases Phase I

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the safety, usability and acceptability of a motorized mobility assistance exoskeleton. The protocol explores the use of the motorized device during static and dynamic rehabilitation sessions focused on walking and functional activities, with the expectation of evaluating the safety and usability of the device in the population studied. The protocol has been focused on defining how the device can be used appropriately in this population in a safe and effective manner by rehabilitation specialists. The study also aims to assess the safety of clinical staff who implement the intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety as number of serious device adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: after each use of exoskeleton, for 5 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Presence of a serious device adverse events where the participant or therapist is involved

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety as presence of adverse events or adverse device events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: after each use of exoskeleton, for 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of a device adverse events where the participant or therapist is involved.

secondary_outcome.measure: Exercises [measured as time per exercise in seconds]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: after each use of exoskeleton, for 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as time per event for at each therapy session.

secondary_outcome.measure: Transfers [measured as time to carry out the transfers in seconds]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At each use of exoskeleton, for 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as time to carry out the transfers

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptability [number of participants which discontinue the participation during the trial in relation with the included participants]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the study, at the 5th week
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as abandon ratio

secondary_outcome.measure: Accessibility [number of potential participants in relation with the included participants]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the study, at the 5th week
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as relation between number of participants and number of potential participants which weren't recruited

secondary_outcome.measure: Fall Prevalence [number of falls during the using of the device]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the use of the device, for 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Number of falling events ocurred from the participant or therapist

secondary_outcome.measure: Skin integrity [number of skin injuries related to the device]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after each use of exoskeleton, for 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: skin integrity measured as the number of skin injuries

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain [Wong-Baker FACES Pain Rating Scale]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the use of the device, during 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Pain registered before and after the use of the device, by the participant and therapist. The options are from 1 to 6. A higher score means a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Fatigue [Borg Rating Scale of Perceived Exertion]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the use of the device, during 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Fatigue registered before and after the use of the device, by the participant and therapist. Measured from 0 to 10, being 0 as fully rested and 10 very tired. A higher score means a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Spasticity [Modified Ashworth Scale]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the use of the device, during 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Spasticity registered before and after the use of the device

secondary_outcome.measure: Heart rate [sphygmomanometer]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the use of the device, during 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Number of heart bets per minute

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical evaluation [number of physical injuries detected]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the use of the device, during 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Physical Evaluation as presence of tissue damage

secondary_outcome.measure: Muscle Strength [measured with Hand Held Dynamometer in N]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the first day, 3rd week and 5th week
secondary_outcome.description: Muscle Strength measured at hip, knee and ankle muscles

secondary_outcome.measure: ROM [measured with goniometer]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the first day, 3rd week and 5th week
secondary_outcome.description: Range of Movement

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional Mobility [Functional Ambulation Category scale]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the first day, 3rd week and 5th week
secondary_outcome.description: Functional Mobility with and without the device

secondary_outcome.measure: System Usability [System Usability Scale]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the study, 5th week
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of System's Usability measured by the therapist

secondary_outcome.measure: Distance covered walking [6MWT]

secondary_outcome.measure: Device malfunction [as number and type of device malfunction]

secondary_outcome.measure: Particpant's stability [Functional Reach Test]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the first day, 3rd week and 5th week
secondary_outcome.description: Functional Reach Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Systolic/Diastolic Pressure [sphygmomanometer]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the use of the device, during 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Systolic Pressure and Diastolic Pressure measured with sphygmomanometer (measured in mmHg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Breath Rate [number of breaths per minute]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the use of the device, during 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Number of breaths per minute

secondary_outcome.measure: SpO2 [pulse oximeter]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the use of the device, during 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: SpO2 measured as %

arm_group.description: 9 treatment sessions will be performed with the ATLAS2030 exoskeleton. The rehabilitation sessions last approximately 90 minutes. Two sessions are scheduled per week, for two weeks.

intervention.description: The participants will perform physical therapy with the ATLSA2030 device, for 90 minutes per session.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Maximum user weight of 35 kg
- Thigh length (distance from the greater trochanter to the lateral condyle of the tibia) from 24 cm to 40 cm.
- Leg length (distance from the lateral condyle of the tibia to the lateral malleolus) from 23 to 39 cm.
- Pelvis width (between greater trochanters) from 24 to 35 cm.
- Ability to achieve ankle dorsiflexion to 90˚
- 20º or more hip flessum.
- 20º or more knee flessum.
- No allergies to any of the ATLAS materials: cotton, nylon, polyester, polyamide, polyethylene or propylene.
- Informed consent signed by legal guardians.
- Confirmed diagnosis of cerebral palsy or neuromuscular disease affecting walking ability at early development stages
- Stable medical condition with no changes in disease-specific medication in the last 6 months, and additional medication in the last month.
- Patient being followed according to the recommended standards for his or her illness
- Ability to maintain, spontaneously or with a brace, the head and trunk while standing and walking.
- No need for daytime ventilation (have an oxygen saturation and PCO2 with normal ambient oxygen
- Score on the FAC scale between 1 and 4 points
- Not being able to walk without assistance
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient's inability to follow simple instructions and/or communicate discomfort.
- Invasive or non-invasive daytime ventilation.
- Orthostatic hypotension.
- 20º or more hip flessum.
- 20º or more knee flessum
- Scoliosis with a Cobb angle of more than 25º that cannot wear a corset during the test.
- Severe skin injury to the lower extremities.
- Scheduled surgery (spine, extremities) during the period of the study or surgery performed (spine, extremities) in the last 6 months.
- History of fracture without trauma.
- History of traumatic bone fracture in lower limbs or pelvic girdle in the last 3 months
- Not receiving regular standing rehabilitation sessions.
- Absence of control of the head or trunk in an upright position without the possibility of wearing a corset during the use of the exoskeleton
- Refusal of the patient or legal guardian to include the child in the study.
- Skin problems (diseases, allergies, sensitivity ...) that prevent the use of exoskeleton accessories on the skin of patients.
